text:
The violent scenes in Swansea last night were completely unacceptable and will not be tolerated anywhere in Wales. 

Thank you @SWPSwansea for bringing the situation under control and continuing to monitor it closely this morning.

Mae’r trais y gwelwn yn Abertawe neithiwr yn hollol annerbyniol. Dydyn ni ddim yn goddef yr ymddygiad yma unrhyw le yng Nghymru.

Diolch i @HeddluDeCymru am ymateb a pharhau i fonitro’r sefyllfa yn agos bore ma.

This is where it gets complicated. There are three different types of the so-called India variant, which we are closely monitoring. 

Of the 41 cases in Wales, 25 are cases of the variant of concern (VOC) – this is the variant which we’re most concerned about.

Yn y cyfamser, dylen ni gyd barhau i ddiogelu ein hunain ac eraill drwy wisgo masg pan fo angen, cadw pellter a golchi dwylo'n rheolaidd.

Dylech hefyd dderbyn y eich gwahoddiad i gael y dos cyntaf neu’r ail ddos o’r brechlyn pan ddaw yr amser. 
Diolch.

Dyma lle mae'n mynd yn gymhleth. Mae tri math gwahanol o'r amrywiad Indiaidd, ac rydym yn ei fonitro'n agos. 

O'r 41 achos yng Nghymru, mae 25 yn achosion o'r amrywiad pryderus (variant of concern) - dyma'r amrywiad yr ydym yn poeni fwyaf amdano.

Let’s continue to wear a mask where needed, keeping our distance, and washing our hands regularly.

Please also take up the offer when you’re invited for your first or second dose of the vaccine. By doing all these things you’re protecting yourself and others.

There are now 41 cases in Wales of the so-called India coronavirus variant. This new strain variant could be more transmissible than the Kent variant, which is the dominant form of the virus in the UK.

We’re closely monitoring the situation and all cases are being investigated.

Mae 41 o achosion o’r amrywiolyn Indiaidd yng Nghymru. Gallai'r straen yma fod yn fwy trosglwyddadwy na’r straen o Caint, sef straen amlycaf y feirws yn y DU.

Rydym yn monitro'r sefyllfa'n ofalus ac mae pob achos yn cael ei ymchwilio’n llawn.

Over half of adults under 40 in Wales have now received their first dose, and 10% of those have also received their second. 

Thank you to our brilliant vaccinators across the country for everything you are doing to protect us from this awful virus. Diolch.

Mae dros hanner yr oedolion dan 40 oed yng Nghymru bellach wedi derbyn eu dos cyntaf, ac mae 10% o'r rheini hefyd wedi derbyn eu hail ddos.

Diolch i’r timau brechu gwych ledled Cymru am bopeth maent yn ei wneud i'n hamddiffyn rhag y firws ofnadwy hwn. Diolch.

This year, the @Urdd's Peace and Goodwill Message focuses on Equality for Women.

Two thirds of our newly appointed Cabinet are women - we want to inspire our next generation. A generation with vision, drive and commitment to Wales, peace, and the world. Thank you. https://t.co/qwGqgw7exb

Eleni, mae Neges Heddwch ac Ewyllys Da'r @Urdd yn canolbwyntio ar Gydraddoldeb i Ferched.

Mae dwy ran o dair o'n Cabinet newydd yn ferched - rydym am ysbrydoli'r genhedlaeth nesaf. Cenhedlaeth gyda gweledigaeth, ysfa, ac ymrwymiad i Gymru, heddwch, a'r byd. Diolch o galon. https://t.co/SV0gKBvMNe

I would like to wish Chag Sameach to Jewish communities in Wales and around the world who will be celebrating the final day of the Shavuot today. 

Although Shavuot will have to be celebrated a little differently this year, I wish you a happy and peaceful celebration.

Dymunaf Chag Sameach i gymunedau Iddewig yng Nghymru a ledled y byd heddiw wrth iddynt ddathlu diwrnod olaf Shavuot. 

Er bod rhaid dathlu ychydig yn wahanol eleni, rwyf yn gobeithio y cewch chi gyd ddathliad hapus a heddychlon.

Diolch i’ch gwaith caled chi, rydym yn gallu llacio cyfyngiadau ymhellach o yfory. 

Bydd y pandemig yn parhau i daflyd heriau newydd atom - ond drwy weithio a’n gilydd i ddiogelu Cymru, gallwn barhau i ddatgloi ein cymdeithas, a dechrau ein hadferiad. https://t.co/1cGSUK4n30

Thanks to the hard work of people all over Wales, we are able to further ease restrictions in Wales from tomorrow. 

This pandemic will throw new surprises at us - but if we continue to work together to keep each other safe, we can continue to unlock Wales and start our recovery. https://t.co/E8rhjaOIj2

This week I had my second dose of the Oxford AstraZeneca vaccine. I'm one of almost 900,000 people across Wales fully vaccinated against coronavirus.

Diolch to @CV_UHB for all their hard work vaccinating people. When you get your vaccine, you’re protecting yourself and others. https://t.co/Y4WClmmmy7

Wythnos yma cefais fy ail ddos o frechlyn AstraZeneca Rhydychen. Rwy'n un o bron i 900,000 o bobl ledled Cymru sydd wedi eu brechu'n llawn yn erbyn coronafeirws.

Diolch i staff @BIP_CaF am eu holl waith caled. Drwy gael ein brechu, rydym yn amddiffyn ein hunain ac eraill. https://t.co/lZvF7Z4viA

For 100 years @PoppyLegion has been providing vital and life changing support to our Armed Forces community.

As it celebrates this landmark, I want to thank everyone involved for all the wonderful work they do.

Diolch o galon a Penblwydd hapus. https://t.co/DwIQfSbF2Z

Ers canmlwydd, mae @PoppyLegion wedi bod yn darparu cymorth hanfodol sy'n newid bywydau i'n cymuned Lluoedd Arfog.

Wrth iddi ddathlu'r tirnod hwn, hoffwn ddiolch i bawb sy'n gysylltiedig am yr holl waith gwych y maent yn ei gwneud.

Diolch o galon a phen-blwydd hapus. https://t.co/ZXHMcqMb8E

It is because of your actions that we can make these changes.

Please continue to do everything you can to #KeepWalesSafe.

Join me live on @WelshGovernment at 12:15pm today for more details.

We’re continuing to monitor the spread of the Indian variant closely – it can travel very quickly and spread easily from person to person.

There have been a number of cases across the UK, including in Wales. I will confirm if we can make more changes on 4 June.

If conditions allow, we will be able to relax restrictions again on 7 June.

This will include allowing up to 3 households to form an extended household, up to 6 people will be able to meet inside and up to 30 people can meet outdoors.

I'm delighted to return as First Minister and to say - thanks to your hard work - we can continue to relax coronavirus restrictions in Wales.

From Monday indoor hospitality and entertainment venues can reopen, and more people can enjoy organised activities indoors and outdoors.

Rydym yn gallu cymryd y camau yma oherwydd popeth rydych chi wedi gwneud i ddiogelu Cymru.

Daliwch ati i wneud popeth yn eich gallu i ddiogelu eich gilydd.

Ymunwch â fi yn fyw ar @LlywodraethCym am 12:15pm heddiw am fwy o wybodaeth.

Rydym yn parhau i fonitro lledaeniad y straen Indiaidd o coronafeirws – mae’n gallu lledaenu yn gyflym ac o berson i berson.

Mae yna nifer o achosion ar draws y DU, gan gynnwys yma yng Nghymru. Byddaf yn cadarnhau unrhyw newidiadau pellach ar 4 Mehefin.

Os yw’r sefyllfa iechyd cyhoeddus yn caniatáu, byddwn yn codi mwy o gyfyngiadau ar 7 Mehefin.

Bydd hyn yn cynnwys caniatáu 3 aelwyd i ffurfio aelwyd estynedig, 6 o bobl i gwrdd mewn cartrefi preifat a 30 o bobl i gwrdd yn yr awyr agored gyda phellter cymdeithasol.

Rydw i wrth fy modd cael dychwelyd i fy swydd fel Prif Weinidog a dweud ein bod yn gallu parhau i godi cyfyngiadau – diolch i chi.

O ddydd Llun, gallwn ailagor tafarndai, bwytai ac adloniant dan do, a bydd mwy o bobl yn cael mwynhau gweithgareddau tu fas a dan do.

Heddiw penodais fy Nghabinet newydd.

Mae'r tîm talentog, uchelgeisiol a phrofiadol hwn yn barod i helpu Cymru adfer rhag coronafeirws i fod yn wlad gryfach, wyrddach a thecach. https://t.co/vvAMgB6BRe

Today I appointed my new Cabinet.

This team of talent, ambition and experience is ready to go to work and set Wales on the path of recovery from coronavirus into a stronger, greener and fairer country. https://t.co/vAY62d7lnR

#EidMubarak i bob Mwslim yng Nghymru ac ar draws y byd sy'n dathlu diwedd #Ramadan.

Yr Eid hwn, byddaf yn myfyrio ar y cyfraniad enfawr y mae ein cymunedau Mwslimaidd yn ei wneud i gymdeithas. Mae eich cryfder a'ch caredigrwydd yn parhau i'm llenwi â gobaith. https://t.co/R5zwEGyRPo

#EidMubarak to all Muslims in Wales and across the world who are celebrating the end of #Ramadan.

This Eid, I will reflect on the enormous contribution our Muslim communities make to society each and every day. Your resilience and generosity continues to fill me with hope. https://t.co/Ebnn1jzHqB

It’s an enormous privilege to continue serving the people of Wales.

It is with great honour that I have today taken the official oath and have been sworn in to continue my tenure as First Minister of Wales 🏴󠁧󠁢󠁷󠁬󠁳󠁿 https://t.co/CmQSgbVE5g

Mae'n fraint enfawr parhau i wasanaethu pobl Cymru. 

Gydag anrhydedd enfawr, rwyf heddiw wedi tyngu'r llw swyddogol i barhau fel Prif Weinidog Cymru 🏴󠁧󠁢󠁷󠁬󠁳󠁿 https://t.co/53qbTkrqDr

As your First Minister, I will move Wales forward 🏴󠁧󠁢󠁷󠁬󠁳󠁿.

The @WelshGovernment will lead Wales into a recovery that builds a stronger, greener and fairer future for everyone. https://t.co/hHRDbnNb52

Fel eich Prif Weinidog, byddaf yn symud Cymru yn ei blaen 🏴󠁧󠁢󠁷󠁬󠁳󠁿.

Bydd @LlywodraethCym yn arwain Cymru i adferiad sy'n adeiladu dyfodol cryfach, gwyrddach a thecach i bawb. https://t.co/t8ltslhYsr

I will be providing further details on these points in my press conference at 12:15 tomorrow on @WelshGovernment.

You can also find further details here ⬇️
https://t.co/WDrxnUIw4p

As the virus' prevalence is low, we’ve been able to bring forward further relaxations originally planned for May 17. 

This means supervised indoor activities for children, and organised indoor activities for up to 15 adults, such as exercise classes can resume from May 3.

From Monday May 3, gyms, leisure centres and fitness facilities will also reopen. 

People will also be able to form extended households with one other households, allowing people to meet indoors once again.

Organised outdoor activities for up to 30 people will be able to take place from Monday, but they must be organised by a responsible body and ensure safety measures are in place.

Wedding receptions and funerals for up to 30 people at regulated premises will be able to resume too

6 people from any 6 households will be able to meet outdoors from Saturday.

From Monday outdoor hospitality including cafes pubs and restaurants, and outdoor attractions, such as funfairs and theme parks, will be able to reopen.

Thanks to a fantastic team effort across Wales, coronavirus cases remain low within our communities.

We now have headroom to continue our step-by-step approach to relaxing restrictions, as well as bring forward some planned relaxations.

More details in the thread below.

Byddaf yn rhoi mwy o fanylion yn fy nghynhadledd i’r wasg am 12:15 yfory ar sianeli @LlywodraethCym 

Cewch wybod mwy yma hefyd ⬇️
https://t.co/A7vuPGqlqu

Am fod yr achosion coronafeirws yn isel, rydym wedi gallu llacio rhai cyfyngiadau yn gynt, heb orfod aros tan 17 Mai.

O 3 Mai ymlaen, caniateir gweithgareddau dan oruchwyliaeth i blant dan do, ynghyd â gweithgareddau dan do i hyd at 15 o oedolion, e.e. dosbarthiadau ffitrwydd.
O ddydd Llun Mai 3, bydd pob campfa, canolfan hamdden a chyfleuster ffitrwydd yn cael ailagor. A bydd pobl yn cael creu aelwyd estynedig i gwrdd ag un aelwyd arall dan do.

Bydd gweithgareddau wedi’u trefnu i hyd at 30 o bobl yn cael digwydd o ddydd Llun ymlaen. Rhaid i gorff cyfrifol eu trefnu a sicrhau’r mesurau diogelwch.

Bydd derbyniadau priodas ac angladdau i hyd ar 30 o bobl yn cael ailddechrau hefyd, mewn eiddo rheoledig.

Bydd 6 o bobl o unrhyw 6 aelwyd yn cael cwrdd tu allan o ddydd Sadwrn ymlaen.

O ddydd Llun, bydd lletygarwch awyr agored fel caffis, tafarndai a bwytai, ac atyniadau fel ffeiriau a pharciau thema, yn cael ailagor.

Diolch i’r gwaith tîm arbennig ledled Cymru, mae’r achosion coronafeirws wedi aros yn isel yn ein cymunedau.

Mae gennym hyblygrwydd nawr i ddechrau llacio’r cyfyngiadau gam wrth gam a dod â rhai o’r dyddiadau ymlaen.

Gweler yr edefyn isod.

I’ll be setting out any further future changes at my press conference this Friday.
 
More information is available here ⬇️
https://t.co/0xQmzBAYHG

As the number of coronavirus cases in Wales continues to fall, we are able to bring forward some changes to the rules. 
 
From Saturday, any 6 people will be able to meet up outdoors. I can also confirm tonight that outside hospitality will be able to reopen safely from 26 April.

Byddaf yn cadarnhau unrhyw newidiadau pellach yn fy nghynhadledd i'r wasg ddydd Gwener yma.
 
Mae mwy o wybodaeth ar gael yma ⬇️
https://t.co/rbj1LqGzgM

Wrth i lefelau coronafeirws yng Nghymru barhau i ostwng, gallwn gyflwyno rhai newidiadau i'r rheolau yn gynharach na disgwyl.

O ddydd Sadwrn, bydd unrhyw 6 pherson yn gallu cwrdd yn yr awyr agored. Gallaf hefyd gadarnhau y bydd lletygarwch tu allan yn gallu ailagor o 26 Ebrill.

At 3pm today, I will join people across the country in a minute silence to mark HRH The Duke of Edinburgh’s funeral service.
 
My thoughts are with Her Majesty the Queen, his children, and their families as they remember his remarkable life and years of service to the crown.

Am 3pm heddiw, byddaf yn ymuno â phobl ledled y DU mewn munud o ddistawrwydd i nodi angladd Ei Uchelder Brenhinol Dug Caeredin.
 
Bydd Ei Mawrhydi y Frenhines, ei phlant, a’u teuluoedd yn fy meddyliau wrth iddynt gofio ei fywyd nodedig a’i flynyddoedd o wasanaeth i’r goron.

Incredibly sad to hear of the passing of HRH The Duke of Edinburgh. 

He served the crown with selfless devotion and will be sorely missed by the people of Wales and the many organisations he supported.

My condolences to Her Majesty the Queen and the family during this sad time. https://t.co/CYbdntxLxz

Hynod o drist clywed am farwolaeth Ei Uchelder Brenhinol Dug Caeredin.

Gwasanaethodd y goron gydag ymroddiad diflino a bydd colled fawr ar ei ôl i bobl Cymru a’r sefydliadau niferus y bu’n eu cefnogi.

Cydymdeimlaf ag Ei Mawrhydi y Frenhines a’r teulu brenhinol yn eu tristwch. https://t.co/uvWQP3TPf9
https://t.co/a4Sl9GKJ3U

As coronavirus cases continue to fall, we can bring forward the lifting of some restrictions.

Gyms and leisure centres will be able to reopen on 3 May and people in Wales can form an extended household.

This is a week earlier than planned and will be confirmed on 22 April.
https://t.co/vk4uMI2rO7

Mae achosion o’r coronafeirws yn parhau i ostwng, felly rydym yn gallu codi rhai cyfyngiadau wythnos yn gynharach.

Bydd campfeydd a chanolfannau hamdden yn ailagor ar 3 Mai a byddwn yn gallu ffurfio aelwyd estynedig.

Bydd hyn yn cael ei gadarnhau yn yr adolygiad ar 22 Ebrill.
Sorry to hear of the loss of Dame Cheryl Gillan, after a long illness. She was the first woman to be Secretary of State for Wales and her connections with Llandaf were ones she never forgot.
Mae'n ddrwg gennyf glywed am farwolaeth y Fonesig Cheryl Gillan, ar ôl salwch hir. Cheryl oedd y fenyw gyntaf i fod yn Ysgrifennyddes Gwladol Cymru, a ni anghofiodd ei chysylltiadau â Llandaf.

Today, I will be confirming the changes that will come into effect on the 12 of April. 

I will also set out our plan to ease restrictions up to the middle of May if public health conditions remain positive.

More details in my live press conference with @CMOWales at 12:15.

Heddiw byddaf yn cadarnhau y newidiadau a ddaw ar 12 Ebrill. 

Byddaf hefyd yn gosod ein cynllun i lacio cyfyngiadau hyd at ganol Mai, os yw’r sefyllfa iechyd yn parhau i fod yn ffafriol.

Mwy o wybodaeth yn fy nghynhadledd i’r wasg gyda @cmowales am 12:15.

Wales is moving out of alert level four and starting to move into level three. Step-by-step Wales is opening up while we all work together to keep the virus under control.

Thank you for everything you’re doing to #KeepWalesSafe

Stay local will be lifted, and for the next 2 weeks people living in Wales can travel around Wales – this is to help keep the virus under control. 

We’ll keep this under review and if the public health situation remains positive, travel in and out of Wales will resume 12 April.

We’re also changing the rules to enable organised outdoor activities and sports for under-18s to restart and from tomorrow up to six people from two different households can meet outdoors, not including children under 11.

Our amazing tourism sector will begin to re-open. We’ll start by lifting the stay local rule and enabling self-contained accommodation to open to people living in Wales from the same household or support bubble.

Thanks to a real team effort across Wales, coronavirus cases remain stable. We have the headroom to continue our careful, step-by-step approach to relaxing restrictions.

In this thread I’ll outline the next set of changes that will come into effect from tomorrow.

Mae Cymru yn symud allan o lefel pedwar ac yn dechrau symud i lefel tri. Mae Cymru yn ailagor gam wrth gam, tra ein bod ni i gyd yn cydweithio i gadw'r feirws dan reolaeth.

Diolch am bopeth rydych yn ei wneud. #DiogeluCymru.

Byddwn yn llacio’r rheol ‘aros yn lleol’ ac am y pythefnos nesaf gall pobl Cymru deithio o amgylch ein cenedl - i gadw lefelau'r feirws yn isel.

Os yw'r sefyllfa yn parhau’n gadarnhaol, bydd teithio i mewn ac allan o Gymru yn ailddechrau ar 12 Ebrill.

Rydym hefyd yn newid y rheolau i ganiatáu gweithgareddau awyr agored i bobl o dan 18 oed. Gall hyd at chwech o bobl o ddwy aelwyd wahanol hefyd gwrdd yn yr awyr agored o yfory ymlaen, heb gynnwys plant dan 11.
O yfory, bydd ein sector twristiaeth yn dechrau ailagor. Byddwn yn dechrau trwy godi'r rheol aros yn lleol a galluogi llety hunangynhwysol i agor drigolion Cymru o'r un aelwyd neu swigen gefnogaeth.

Diolch i’ch gwaith caled chi, mae’r achosion coronafeirws yn parhau'n sefydlog. Rydym felly yn gallu parhau i lacio cyfyngiadau gam wrth gam.

Yn yr edefyn isod, rwy’n amlinellu'r set nesaf o newidiadau a ddaw i rym o yfory.

Mae rheolau etholiadau yn golygu bod cyfyngiadau ar yr hyn y cawn ei rannu ac ymateb iddo ar ein sianeli cyfryngau cymdeithasol.

Election rules mean there are limits on what we can share and respond to from our social media channels.

https://t.co/XZYyIJeNug

We are now in a pre-election period until after the Senedd elections on 6 May.

This means that I'm limited as to what I can share using this channel. However, I will continue to provide you with important updates relating to coronavirus regulations as they happen. Diolch.

Rydym bellach mewn cyfnod cyn-etholiadol tan ar ôl etholiad y Senedd ar 6 Mai.

Mae hyn yn golygu fod cyfyngiadau ar yr hyn y gallaf ei rannu ar y sianel hon. Er hyn, byddaf yn parhau i roi diweddariadau pwysig i chi am y rheoliadau coronafirws wrth iddynt ddigwydd. Diolch.

If you’re watching the match today, please do so with members of your household only. The last thing we want is to celebrate a potential Grand Slam weekend with a surge in coronavirus cases.

This step-by-step approach allows us to gradually open up Wales while keeping a close eye on the virus. 

I will provide more details and information about funding to support businesses in my press conference at 12:15.

We’ll gradually reopen non-essential retail from 22 March - starting by lifting the restrictions on what shops which are currently open can sell. Garden centres can open too. 

If cases continue to fall, all shops will be able to reopen from 12 April – the same date as England.
Hairdressers and barbers can open from Monday by appointment for haircuts, and we hope all close contact services will be open from 12 April if public health outlook stays positive.

From tomorrow, 4 people from 2 households can meet outdoors, outdoor sports facilities can open and indoor care homes visits can restart.

On Monday, primary pupils and students doing qualifications will return to school. Schools also have flexibility to bring back years 10 & 12.

Thanks to a real team effort across Wales, coronavirus cases are now at their lowest since mid-September. We have some headroom for a careful and phased approach to start unlocking Wales. We’ll start by moving from stay at home to stay local.

For now, please stay home so we can keep infections down and protect our NHS. 

I'll be providing further details in my press conference at 12:15.

If cases continue to fall, we will use the next three weeks to see if we can get more students back to schools and colleges before Easter. 

We’ll also look carefully at options for re-opening some non-essential retail and close contact services, like hairdressing.

Thanks to a real team effort across Wales, coronavirus cases are now at their lowest since the end of September.

We need you to stay at home for a bit longer – I know this will be frustrating but we need to make sure our youngest children can return to school safely.

Together, we will keep Wales safe.

People in Caerphilly County have shown the most amazing resilience and care for others during this pandemic. 

Now we need to work together again to prevent coronavirus spreading, to protect our families, friends, and communities.

By working with our TTP teams you’re helping to break the chain of transmission and prevent the spread of the virus. 

Our system in Wales is helping to control coronavirus thanks to everyone’s cooperation.

If you have symptoms, get a test. Here’s the link below👇
https://t.co/5gfHgGH6Ms

If the test is positive, our Test Trace Protect team will give you a call and ask a few questions about where you’ve been in the last few days.

To help stop the virus spreading it’s really important we all follow these simple steps:

- Stay 2m apart and wear a face covering when you can't
- Wash your hands regularly
- If you live in Caerphilly County, don’t meet indoors 
- Stay at home if you have symptoms

Coronavirus spreads quickly from person to person.

You can have it and pass it on without having symptoms. It’s now widespread in the community in Caerphilly County.

Our Test, Trace, Protect system shows the rise in cases is being driven by people meeting in each other’s homes and lack of social distancing.

Pubs and restaurants are not the cause. To bring cases down we have to pause rules allowing people to meet indoors for the time being.

I know this will be upsetting and inconvenient. We haven’t taken this decision lightly.

Our decision has been guided by our scientists and medical experts, who have been closely monitoring the rise in cases.

From 6pm, we’re introducing new restrictions in Caerphilly County area. This is the first time we’ve taken such action. 

We’re doing this because coronavirus cases have risen sharply - we need to take action to protect your health and stop the virus spreading https://t.co/1pdwUXaApx

•Give @WelshGoverment our fair share of funding so we can deliver our plans to transform rail services here

Roedd y PW yn cytuno ei bod yn bwysig ein bod yn cydweithio'n agos ac yn gwneud popeth a allwn ni i gefnogi gweithwyr Ford, eu teuluoedd a'r gymuned ehangach.

Dywedais wrth y PW y gwnawn ni bopeth o fewn ein gallu i geisio perswadio Ford i barhau i gynhyrchu ym Mhen-y-bont a rhoi cymorth i'r gweithlu a’r gymuned. Pwysais ar y PW i gynnig o leiaf yr un lefel o gymorth ag a oedd ar gael i Swindon mewn ymateb i Honda.
Siaradais â'r Prif Weinidog am Ford y prynhawn yma i bwysleisio pwysigrwydd y ffatri i Ben-y-bont a'r ffaith bod hon yn ergyd chwerw i'r holl weithlu hynod o fedrus.
The PM agreed that it was important we work closely together and do everything we can to support the workers at Ford, their families and the wider community.

I told the PM we’ll do everything we can to try to persuade Ford to maintain production in Bridgend & provide support to the workforce & community. I pressed the PM to offer at least the same level of support available to Swindon in response to Honda.
I spoke with the Prime Minister about Ford this afternoon to emphasise the importance of the plant to Bridgend & the bitter blow this is for the loyal & highly skilled workforce.

We’ll continue to actively pursue alternative investment on the site – and talks are already underway with potential investors. We’re also setting up a taskforce to provide a tailored package of support to those affected by yesterday’s announcement.
I’ll also be speaking to the PM later today – and will reiterate our demand that Bridgend is offered at least the same level of support they offered to Honda.

I stressed that we would do everything possible during the consultation period to get the company to reconsider their decision and retain production in Bridgend – I plan to raise this with senior Ford representatives as soon as possible.

Byddwn yn parhau i fynd ati i chwilio am fuddsoddiad arall ar gyfer y safle-ac mae trafodaethau eisoes ar y gweill gyda buddsoddwyr posib. Rydym hefyd yn sefydlu tasglu i ddarparu pecyn o gymorth i'r rhai yr effeithiwyd gan gyhoeddiad ddoe.
Byddaf hefyd yn siarad â Phrif Weinidog y DU yn ddiweddarach heddiw i ailadrodd ein cais fod Pen-y-Bont yn cael cynnig yr un faint o gymorth â Honda.

Pwysleisiais y byddem yn gwneud popeth posibl yn ystod y cyfnod ymgynghori i gael y cwmni i ailystyried eu penderfyniad a chadw'r gwaith cynhyrchu ym Mhen-y-bont – rwy'n bwriadu codi hyn gydag uwch gynrychiolwyr Ford cyn gynted â phosibl.

Newydd gwrdd ag arweinwyr Undeb Ford ym Mhen-y-bont. Mae gwir deimlad o ddicter a bradychiad, sy'n ddealladwy pryd mae’r gweithwyr wedi dangos teyrngarwch i’r cwmni dros y pedwar degawd diwethaf. https://t.co/14jibGWG3B

Just met with Ford union leaders & workers in Bridgend. There is a palpable sense of anger & betrayal, which is understandable when workers have shown the company loyalty & great service over the four decades it’s been in Bridgend. https://t.co/UXTshUvq3p

Bydd @LlywodraethCym yn gwneud popeth o fewn ei gallu i gefnogi'r rheini y bydd y cyhoeddiad hwn yn effeithio arnyn nhw, ac i gydweithio â'r holl bartneriaid i edrych ar yr opsiynau ar gyfer dyfodol y ffatri.

Mae'r newyddion bod ffatri Ford yn cau yn ofnadwy o drist i'r gweithlu teyrngar, i gymuned Pen-y-bont ar Ogwr ac i'r rheini sy'n rhan o'r gadwyn gyflenwi. 
Dyw'r penderfyniad hwn ddim yn unrhyw adlewyrchiad ar yr unigolion medrus iawn sydd wedi rhoi gwasanaeth gwych i'r cwmni.
.@WelshGovernment will do everything in its power to support those impacted by this announcement and to work with the company, unions and others to explore options for the future of the plant.

The closure of the Ford engine plant is incredibly sad news for the loyal workforce, for the community of Bridgend and for those in the supply chain. 

This decision in no way reflects on the highly skilled individuals who have given the company great service over four decades.

Mae’r gobaith o sicrhau Brexit trefnus – un sy’n diogelu ein heconomi a swyddi - erbyn 31 Hydref nawr yn llai tebygol eto. Fydd newid arweinydd yn newid dim – mae gwir angen dull newydd o edrych ar Brexit, a hynny ar sail cyfaddawd, er mwyn pontio’r rhaniadau yn ein gwlad 3/3

Fodd bynnag, ei llinellau coch hi sydd wedi ei harwain at ddiwedd y ffordd a’n gadael ni mewn llanast a grëwyd ganddi hi. Gornest am yr arweinyddiaeth yw’r peth diwethaf sydd ei angen ar y wlad wrth i ni negodi un o’r heriau mwyaf mae’n gwlad wedi’i wynebu ers degawdau. 2/3
Dydw i erioed wedi amau ymroddiad y Prif Weinidog i wasanaeth cyhoeddus na’i hymrwymiad i wneud ei gwaith, ac rwy’n dymuno’n dda iddi yn y dyfodol 1/3

The prospect of achieving an orderly Brexit – one that protects our economy & jobs – by the 31st October seems less likely. A change of leader will change nothing, we need a change of approach to Brexit based on compromise & a will to heal the growing divisions in our country 3/3

It is however, her red lines that have brought her to the end of the road and left us in a mess of her making.  A Conservative leadership contest is the last thing we need as we negotiate one of the biggest challenges and uncertainties our country has faced in decades. 2/3
I've never doubted the Prime Minister’s sense of public service or her commitment to do her job & I wish her well for the future. 1/3

As nothing has changed, we continue to believe we need a cross-party agreement to rewrite the Political Declaration – or failing that a public vote.

Nothing has changed. The PM’s “changes” simply reiterate more clearly EU commitments already made in the Withdrawal Agreement & Political Declaration. 
Even if PM miraculously squeezes through tonight’s vote, we won’t have the stable majority we need for future negotiations.

Rydym yn meddwl am ei deulu heddiw a phawb oedd yn ei adnabod.
Ond parodrwydd Paul i siarad dros achosion y tu hwnt i'r prif feysydd gwleidyddol oedd yn tynnu sylw at fel gwleidydd hynod ddewr a didwyll

Roedd Paul Flynn yn un o gewri mudiad Llafur Cymru a bydd y newyddion heddiw'n peri tristwch mawr I bawb oedd yn ei adnabod.

Roedd yn un o gyfathrebwyr mwyaf effeithiol ei genhedlaeth - yn Nhy'r Cyffredin a'r tu allan

I first met him more than 35 years ago, and it has been a privilege to have worked with him, in the run-up to the devolution era and beyond. 

Our thoughts are with his family today and all those who knew him.
But it was Paul’s willingness to speak up for causes beyond the political mainstream, which marked him out as a politician of real courage and integrity.

Paul Flynn was a giant of the Welsh Labour movement and today’s news will be a source of great sadness to all those who knew him. 

He was one of the most effective communicators of his generation - inside the House of Commons and outside.
